intro: Argyreia coacta, commonly known as the holy ghost plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces long, trailing stems that often curl into a spiral when dried. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures. The flowers are also used in floral arrangements due to their unique appearance and durability.
